speaker: Huber
content: She left candles unattended in the den. The paramedic said she was lucky. She could've been killed.
mark: unattended adj. 无人看管的，无人照料的；未被注意的，未被处理的； attend v. 随同，陪同；伴随；出席，参加；注意，专心；处理，照料；致力于
den n. 兽穴；窝点；活动室，休闲室
当 "could've" 后面紧跟一个辅音（比如 been, died, hurt）时，那个 /v/ 的音往往会被 “吃掉” 或者 “同化”，直接从 "d" 滑到后面的辅音。

speaker: Lynette
content: She ran out with nothing on. She was having sex with some guy when the fire started.

speaker: Gabrielle
mark: What happened 特殊，不用did happen

speaker: Lynette
content: He got smoke inhalation. He's at the hospital.
mark: inhalation n. 吸入，吸入法；吸入剂，吸入物 smoke inhalation 烟雾吸入伤害
in the hospital（住院）at the hospital（在医院）

speaker: Bree
content: Susan, are you all right? You look awful.

speaker: Susan
content: I'm fine. I just feel really bad for Eddie.

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Oh, honey, don't worry about Eddie. She's a strong lady.

speaker: Lynette
content: Absolutely. She'll get through this. She'll find a way to survive.
mark: get through 完成; 熬过
find a way to survive 找到生存之道；设法生存下去

speaker: Bree
mark: We all do 我们所有人都这样做；我们全都如此
